name: Human Exploitation
description: In an effort to disrupt and prevent offline harm, we remove content that facilitates or coordinates the exploitation of humans, including human trafficking (the business of depriving someone of liberty for profit) and human smuggling. Human trafficking relies on deception, force, and coercion, and degrades humans by depriving them of their freedom while economically or materially benefiting others.

categories.name: Human Trafficking
categories.description: Content that recruits, facilitates, or exploits people through various forms of human trafficking

subcategories.name: Minor Sex Trafficking
subcategories.description: Any commercial sexual activity involving a minor (under 18), with or without force, fraud, or coercion
examples: Offering minors for paid sexual services
Job ads for sex work targeting minors

subcategories.name: Adult Sex Trafficking
subcategories.description: Commercial sexual activity involving adults through force, fraud, or coercion
examples: Recruiting adults for sex work through threats
Offering adults for commercial sex via coercion
False promises of legitimate work leading to sex trafficking

subcategories.name: Third-Party Commercial Sexual Activity (CCSA)
subcategories.description: Third party recruits, facilitates, or benefits from commercial sexual activity of adults without force/fraud/coercion
examples: Recruiting for adult commercial sex work
Third party offering adults for paid sexual services

subcategories.name: Sale of Children or Illegal Adoptions
subcategories.description: Soliciting or offering children (born or unborn) for sale or adoption without legal process
examples: Adoption without mention of legal process

subcategories.name: Orphanage Trafficking and Voluntourism
subcategories.description: Exploiting children through orphanages for trafficking purposes

subcategories.name: Forced Marriages
subcategories.description: Marriage without consent of one or both parties, including child marriages
examples: Marriage where party cannot leave or refuse
conditions: Lack of consent OR minor involved

subcategories.name: Labor Exploitation
subcategories.description: Exploiting people for labor through force, fraud, or coercion with explicit or primary indicators
examples: Job with illegal practices explicitly mentioned
conditions: 1 explicit indicator OR 2 primary indicators OR 1 primary + 1 secondary indicator

subcategories.name: Labor Abuse
subcategories.description: Exploiting people for labor through unfair or harmful means without force/fraud/coercion

subcategories.name: Domestic Servitude
subcategories.description: Trafficking for domestic work inside private homes through force, fraud, coercion, or deception
examples: Recruiting maids with visitor visa instead of work contract
Bypassing labor regulations for domestic workers

subcategories.name: Domestic Helpers Recruitment
subcategories.description: Recruiting domestic helpers lacking signals of exploitation
examples: Job posting for domestic helper in private home
Seeking domestic workers without exploitation signals

subcategories.name: Non-Regenerative Organ Trafficking
subcategories.description: Recruiting, facilitating, or exploiting people for organ trafficking
examples: Offering kidney for sale with price
Stating intention to sell others' organs

subcategories.name: Offering Own Organs
subcategories.description: Content offering one's own non-regenerative organs for sale
examples: I want to sell my kidney
Offering my organ with financial difficulties mentioned
conditions: Plus factors: financial difficulty, age, medical info, compensation, location, contact

subcategories.name: Forced Criminal Activity
subcategories.description: Forcing people to commit crimes (begging, drug trafficking, etc.)

subcategories.name: Use of Child Soldiers
subcategories.description: Recruiting minors into armed groups
examples: Imagery of child soldiers with praise

subcategories.name: Temporary Marriages
subcategories.description: Recruiting for temporary marriages without exchange for money

subcategories.name: Jobs in High-Risk Locations
subcategories.description: Job offers in known trafficking hotspot locations
conditions: Job offer in: Cambodia (Bavet, Pailin, Poipet), Laos (Bokeo), Myanmar (Myawaddy)

categories.name: Human Smuggling
categories.description: Procurement or facilitation of irregular cross-border entry for financial gain

subcategories.name: Offers to Provide/Facilitate Smuggling
subcategories.description: Content offering or facilitating human smuggling services
examples: Offering to help cross border illegally
Fake travel documents for border crossing
conditions: 1 explicit indicator OR 2 primary indicators OR 1 primary + 1 secondary indicator

subcategories.name: Asks for Smuggling Services
subcategories.description: Content requesting human smuggling services
examples: Looking for someone to help cross border illegally
conditions: Soliciting cross-border smuggling OR illegal crossing explicitly mentioned

categories.name: Allowed Content
categories.description: Content that does not violate Human Exploitation policies

subcategories.name: Awareness/Condemnation
subcategories.description: Condemning, raising awareness, or news reporting on human exploitation issues
conditions: Condemns OR raises awareness OR news reporting

subcategories.name: Personal Safety and Asylum Information
subcategories.description: Asking for or sharing information about border crossing safety, asylum, or leaving a country
examples: How to seek asylum in EU
conditions: Personal safety info OR asylum seeking OR legal immigration info

subcategories.name: Legal Adoption Process
subcategories.description: Adoption content with explicit mention of legal process
examples: Seeking legal advice from adoption agency

subcategories.name: Legitimate Organ Donation
subcategories.description: Non-exploitative organ donation through official registers or fundraising
conditions: Official donor register OR fundraising for transplant

subcategories.name: Organ Selling Jokes
subcategories.description: Humorous content about selling organs
examples: I'll sell my kidney to afford concert tickets
Selling an organ for the new PlayStation

subcategories.name: Victim Support Services
subcategories.description: Offering help or resources to exploitation victims

labelHierarchy.label: HE > Human Trafficking > Minor Sex Trafficking
HE > Human Trafficking > Coordinated Commercial Sexual Activity
HE > Human Trafficking > Child Selling/Illegal Adoption
HE > Human Smuggling > Ask for Services

force.description: Use or threatened use of physical violence, assault, restraint or confinement

fraud.description: Intentional misrepresentation for obtaining something of value
examples: False or unrealistic promises about work/living conditions

coercion.description: Threats of serious harm or restraint to make person believe failure to act would result in harm
examples: Threats of deportation or law enforcement
Threats to expose engagement in commercial sex

indicators: Explicit mention of bypassing labor regulations
Job stated as illegal / needing illegal workers
Offering to help 'escape' current employer for fee
Palm oil plantation recruitment (cross-border without visa, by individual, recruiting couples/families)
Requiring loan from employer to secure job
Cross-border job + visitor visa instead of work visa

primary.description: 2 primary OR 1 primary + 1 secondary = Labor Exploitation; 1 primary = Labor Abuse
indicators: No skills required for skilled job
Pay fee to be employed (purpose unspecified)
Cross-border job + no work permit required

secondary.description: 2 secondary = Labor Abuse; 1 primary + 1 secondary = Labor Exploitation
indicators: Upfront payment or work to pay off fees
Language skills not required for skilled job
Stressing urgency to apply / scarcity of jobs
Travel costs covered then deducted from salary
Unrealistic compensation (>$1000/month for unskilled job in low-wage country)
No entry documents required for border crossing
Terms: smuggle, smuggling services, secret immigration, illegal migrants/migration/travel/immigration

primary.description: 2 primary OR 1 primary + 1 secondary = Human Smuggling
indicators: Transportation method mentioned (foot, car, boat, lorry, RIB)
Route integrity mentioned (guaranteed, safe, secured, avoiding checkpoints)
Fake/fraudulent documents offered (outside explicit crossing context)
Visual smuggling hints (life jackets, boat, travel documents, road signs)
Contact method provided (phone, email, messaging apps, DM me)
Payment discussed (cost, excessive prices, payment method)

examples: Live performances of nudity to sexually stimulate audience
Live streamed sexual activities for money
third_party_signals: Looking for people to work in commercial sexual activities
Having other people available for sex
Mentioning availability of people at brothel
Sexual activity + financial transaction language (rent, for sale, service, booking, rate)

exceptions.name: Awareness/Condemnation
exceptions.description: Content condemning or raising awareness about human exploitation

exceptions.name: News Reporting
exceptions.description: Journalistic coverage of human exploitation issues

exceptions.name: Personal Safety/Asylum Information
exceptions.description: Information about border crossing safety, seeking asylum, or leaving a country legally

exceptions.name: Legal Adoption Process
exceptions.description: Adoption with explicit mention of legal process (lawyer, court, agency)

exceptions.name: Legitimate Organ Donation
exceptions.description: Official donor registers, fundraising for transplant operations

exceptions.name: Organ Selling Jokes
exceptions.description: Humorous content about selling organs (concert tickets, PlayStation, etc.)

exceptions.name: Victim Support Services
exceptions.description: Helping people escape exploitation, providing support resources

exceptions.name: Worker Rights Education
exceptions.description: Content about labor laws, workers' rights, fair labor practices

exceptions.name: Child Soldier Rehabilitation
exceptions.description: Fundraising for child soldier rehabilitation programs

exceptions.name: Fictional Forced Marriage
exceptions.description: Fictional content depicting forced marriages that doesn't facilitate real-world harm

exceptions.name: Forced Marriage Humor
exceptions.description: Satire, parody, or dark humor about forced marriages

trends.name: Nigeria Massage Scam
indicators: Nigeria location but offering in other countries

glossary.human_trafficking: The business of depriving someone of liberty for profit through force, fraud, or coercion to engage in commercial sex, labor, or other activities against their will
glossary.human_smuggling: Procurement or facilitation of irregular cross-border entry for financial or material gain of others
glossary.recruits: Soliciting or targeting individuals for exploitation through force, fraud, coercion, enticement, deception, blackmail, or non-consensual acts
glossary.facilitates: Coordinating transportation, transfer, harboring of victims before or during exploitation
glossary.exploits: Offering, selling, or brokering people for any form of trafficking
glossary.commercial_sexual_activity: Provision of sex act/service for money or anything of value (escort, prostitution, erotic massage, porn, live performances, sex chats, nude photos/videos)
glossary.force: Use or threatened use of physical violence, assault, restraint, or confinement
glossary.fraud: Intentional misrepresentation to obtain something of value (false promises, withholding wages, guaranteeing visas)
glossary.coercion: Threats of serious harm or restraint to compel action (threats to victim/family, deportation threats, document confiscation)
glossary.domestic_servitude: Trafficking for domestic work (cooking, cleaning, laundry, childminding) through force, fraud, coercion, or deception
glossary.labor_exploitation: Exploiting people for labor through force, fraud, or coercion, often through deceptive means
glossary.labor_abuse: Exploiting people for labor through unfair or harmful means without force, fraud, or coercion
glossary.forced_marriage: Marriage without consent of one or both parties, or where parties cannot leave (includes child marriages). Does NOT include arranged marriages with option to refuse
glossary.child_soldier: Person under 18 recruited by or volunteering for military/paramilitary group, including combat, support roles, or sexual abuse
glossary.non_regenerative_organs: Organs that won't grow back: kidneys, livers, hearts, eyeballs, corneas, lungs, intestines, pancreases
glossary.awareness_raising: Sharing information to improve understanding of issues, not inciting violence or spreading hate/misinformation
glossary.news_reporting: Sharing reliable information by news outlets or journalists to increase situational awareness
glossary.imminent: Has just happened, is about to happen, is happening, or ongoing - within 72 hours

operationalGuidelines.minor_consent: Minors cannot consent - content with minor consent signals still violates
operationalGuidelines.ccsa_vs_st: CCSA = no force/fraud/coercion; ST = with force/fraud/coercion
operationalGuidelines.mst_no_force_required: Minor sex trafficking does not require force/fraud/coercion - minor involvement is sufficient
operationalGuidelines.third_party_identification: Look for: third-party pronouns (we, she, they), multiple people offered, plural language, business posting
operationalGuidelines.age_assessment: Direct (age mentioned under 18) + Indirect (bio, username, profile image, 'Potential Minor' tag)
operationalGuidelines.legal_process_negates: Mention of legal process (lawyer, court, adoption agency) negates child selling violation
operationalGuidelines.organ_joke_signals: Humor emojis (ðŸ˜‚ðŸ¤£), reference to buying items by selling organs, flirtatious context
operationalGuidelines.imminent_threat_criteria: Must violate HEx policy + imminent (72 hours) + threat to life/safety + identifiable person
operationalGuidelines.us_escalation: CCSA and ST in US only = escalate; Non-US = label
